Note that this custom layout is saved for the current content element. The Layout dropdown now has the button Save instead of Customize. With this, you could save the layout for the whole site and make it available for other content elements.

  • First, click on Layout, then click Save.

  • In the Save Layout modal, give the layout a Name.

  • Check the Global box, to make layout usable by any user. Otherwise, only the current user will be able to use the created layout.

Exercise: Create a layout for News items

Create a new layout for a News item, save it, and reuse it for another News item.

Solution

First, we create the new layout.

  • Create a News Item.
  • Set the item's Display to Mosaic layout.
  • Click Edit and then select the "News item layout" layout.
  • Click Layout, then choose Customize.
  • Click Insert button, then choose Document Byline.
  • Add a Document Byline to the layout.
  • Click Layout, then choose Save.
  • In the Save Layout box, type in a Name.
  • Check the Global box, then click Save.
  • On the top editing bar, click Save.

Then, we reuse it.

  • Create another News Item.
  • Set the item's Display to Mosaic layout.
  • Click Edit and then select the layout created earlier.
  • Click Save.
